entry.title: hneth/unicol
entry.summary:
The colors of your university

unicol 0.0.0.9009

The colors of your university.

Goal

The R package unicol provides colors and color palettes for various universities.

The unicol package was developed as a collaborative project by the following course:

  • Open Source Software Development in R (ADILT applications, PSY-18040), at University of Konstanz
  • Spring 2023: Tuesdays, 13:30-15:00; in C426
  • Taught by Hansj√∂rg Neth (h.neth@uni.kn, SPDS, University of Konstanz)

The goal of unicol is to provide university color palettes for creating scientific visualizations.

This package is based on the R package unikn and loads key functionality from it.

Installation

You can install the development version of unicol from GitHub with:

# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("hneth/unicol")

Usage

The unicol package provides colors and color palettes, whereas the unikn provides color-related functions:

library(unicol)  # for color palettes
library(unikn)   # for color functions

Contents

The unicol package currently contains 27 color palettes (with a total of 181 colors) from Z institutions.

An overview of the current color palettes provided by the unicol package:

Examples

Here are some examples how the color palettes from unicol can be used:

seecol(yale_1, main = "Primary colors of Yale University")

demopal(berkeley_1, type = 2, main = "Using the colors of Berkeley University")

demopal(nyu_1, type = 3, main = "Using NYU colors")

[File README.Rmd updated on 2023-06-20.]
